Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/qmgr/qmgr_message.c

1/* $NetBSD: qmgr_message.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:47 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* qmgr_message 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* in-core message structures
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include "qmgr.h"
10/*
11/* int qmgr_message_count;
12/* int qmgr_recipient_count;
13/* int qmgr_vrfy_pend_count;
14/*
15/* QMGR_MESSAGE *qmgr_message_alloc(class, name, qflags, mode)
16/* const char *class;
17/* const char *name;
18/* int qflags;
19/* mode_t mode;
20/*
21/* QMGR_MESSAGE *qmgr_message_realloc(message)
22/* QMGR_MESSAGE *message;
23/*
24/* void qmgr_message_free(message)
25/* QMGR_MESSAGE *message;
26/*
27/* void qmgr_message_update_warn(message)
28/* QMGR_MESSAGE *message;
29/*
30/* void qmgr_message_kill_record(message, offset)
31/* QMGR_MESSAGE *message;
32/* long offset;
33/* DESCRIPTION
34/* This module performs en-gross operations on queue messages.
35/*
36/* qmgr_message_count is a global counter for the total number
37/* of in-core message structures (i.e. the total size of the
38/* `active' message queue).
39/*
40/* qmgr_recipient_count is a global counter for the total number
41/* of in-core recipient structures (i.e. the sum of all recipients
42/* in all in-core message structures).
43/*
44/* qmgr_vrfy_pend_count is a global counter for the total
45/* number of in-core message structures that are associated
46/* with an address verification request. Requests that exceed
47/* the address_verify_pending_limit are deferred immediately.
48/* This is a backup mechanism for a more refined enforcement
49/* mechanism in the verify(8) daemon.
50/*
51/* qmgr_message_alloc() creates an in-core message structure
52/* with sender and recipient information taken from the named queue
53/* file. A null result means the queue file could not be read or
54/* that the queue file contained incorrect information. A result
55/* QMGR_MESSAGE_LOCKED means delivery must be deferred. The number
56/* of recipients read from a queue file is limited by the global
57/* var_qmgr_rcpt_limit configuration parameter. When the limit
58/* is reached, the \fIrcpt_offset\fR structure member is set to
59/* the position where the read was terminated. Recipients are
60/* run through the resolver, and are assigned to destination
61/* queues. Recipients that cannot be assigned are deferred or
62/* bounced. Mail that has bounced twice is silently absorbed.
63/* A non-zero mode means change the queue file permissions.
64/*
65/* qmgr_message_realloc() resumes reading recipients from the queue
66/* file, and updates the recipient list and \fIrcpt_offset\fR message
67/* structure members. A null result means that the file could not be
68/* read or that the file contained incorrect information. Recipient
69/* limit imposed this time is based on the position of the message
70/* job(s) on corresponding transport job list(s). It's considered
71/* an error to call this when the recipient slots can't be allocated.
72/*
73/* qmgr_message_free() destroys an in-core message structure and makes
74/* the resources available for reuse. It is an error to destroy
75/* a message structure that is still referenced by queue entry structures.
76/*
77/* qmgr_message_update_warn() takes a closed message, opens it, updates
78/* the warning field, and closes it again.
79/*
80/* qmgr_message_kill_record() takes a closed message, opens it, updates
81/* the record type at the given offset to "killed", and closes the file.
82/* A killed envelope record is ignored. Killed records are not allowed
83/* inside the message content.
84/* DIAGNOSTICS
85/* Warnings: malformed message file. Fatal errors: out of memory.
86/* SEE ALSO
87/* envelope(3) message envelope parser
88/* LICENSE
89/* .ad
90/* .fi
91/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
92/* AUTHOR(S)
93/* Wietse Venema
94/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
95/* P.O. Box 704
96/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
97/*
98/* Preemptive scheduler enhancements:
99/* Patrik Rak
100/* Modra 6
101/* 155 00, Prague, Czech Republic
102/*--*/
103
104/* System library. */
105
106#include <sys_defs.h>
107#include <sys/stat.h>
108#include <stdlib.h>
109#include <stdio.h> /* sscanf() */
110#include <fcntl.h>
111#include <errno.h>
112#include <unistd.h>
113#include <string.h>
114#include <ctype.h>
115
116/* Utility library. */
117
118#include <msg.h>
119#include <mymalloc.h>
120#include <vstring.h>
121#include <vstream.h>
122#include <split_at.h>
123#include <valid_hostname.h>
124#include <argv.h>
125#include <stringops.h>
126#include <myflock.h>
127#include <sane_time.h>
128
129/* Global library. */
130
131#include <dict.h>
132#include <mail_queue.h>
133#include <mail_params.h>
134#include <canon_addr.h>
135#include <record.h>
136#include <rec_type.h>
137#include <sent.h>
138#include <deliver_completed.h>
139#include <opened.h>
140#include <verp_sender.h>
141#include <mail_proto.h>
142#include <qmgr_user.h>
143#include <split_addr.h>
144#include <dsn_mask.h>
145#include <rec_attr_map.h>
146
147/* Client stubs. */
148
149#include <rewrite_clnt.h>
150#include <resolve_clnt.h>
151
152/* Application-specific. */
153
154#include "qmgr.h"
155
156int qmgr_message_count;
157int qmgr_recipient_count;
158int qmgr_vrfy_pend_count;
159
160/* qmgr_message_create - create in-core message structure */
161
162static QMGR_MESSAGE *qmgr_message_create(const char *queue_name,
163 const char *queue_id, int qflags)
164{
165 QMGR_MESSAGE *message;
166
167 message = (QMGR_MESSAGE *) mymalloc(sizeof(QMGR_MESSAGE));
168 qmgr_message_count++;
169 message->flags = 0;
170 message->qflags = qflags;
171 message->tflags = 0;
172 message->tflags_offset = 0;
173 message->rflags = QMGR_READ_FLAG_DEFAULT;
174 message->fp = 0;
175 message->refcount = 0;
176 message->single_rcpt = 0;
177 message->arrival_time.tv_sec = message->arrival_time.tv_usec = 0;
178 message->create_time = 0;
179 GETTIMEOFDAY(&message->active_time);
180 message->queued_time = sane_time();
181 message->refill_time = 0;
182 message->data_offset = 0;
183 message->queue_id = mystrdup(queue_id);
184 message->queue_name = mystrdup(queue_name);
185 message->encoding = 0;
186 message->sender = 0;
187 message->dsn_envid = 0;
188 message->dsn_ret = 0;
189 message->smtputf8 = 0;
190 message->filter_xport = 0;
191 message->inspect_xport = 0;
192 message->redirect_addr = 0;
193 message->data_size = 0;
194 message->cont_length = 0;
195 message->warn_offset = 0;
196 message->warn_time = 0;
197 message->rcpt_offset = 0;
198 message->verp_delims = 0;
199 message->client_name = 0;
200 message->client_addr = 0;
201 message->client_port = 0;
202 message->client_proto = 0;
203 message->client_helo = 0;
204 message->sasl_method = 0;
205 message->sasl_username = 0;
206 message->sasl_sender = 0;
207 message->log_ident = 0;
208 message->rewrite_context = 0;
209 recipient_list_init(&message->rcpt_list, RCPT_LIST_INIT_QUEUE);
210 message->rcpt_count = 0;
211 message->rcpt_limit = var_qmgr_msg_rcpt_limit;
212 message->rcpt_unread = 0;
213 QMGR_LIST_INIT(message->job_list);
214 return (message);
215}
216
217/* qmgr_message_close - close queue file */
218
219static void qmgr_message_close(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
220{
221 vstream_fclose(message->fp);
222 message->fp = 0;
223}
224
225/* qmgr_message_open - open queue file */
226
227static int qmgr_message_open(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
228{
229
230 /*
231 * Sanity check.
232 */
233 if (message->fp)
234 msg_panic("%s: queue file is open", message->queue_id);
235
236 /*
237 * Open this queue file. Skip files that we cannot open. Back off when
238 * the system appears to be running out of resources.
239 */
240 if ((message->fp = mail_queue_open(message->queue_name,
241 message->queue_id,
242 O_RDWR, 0)) == 0) {
243 if (errno != ENOENT)
244 msg_fatal("open %s %s: %m", message->queue_name, message->queue_id);
245 msg_warn("open %s %s: %m", message->queue_name, message->queue_id);
246 return (-1);
247 }
248 return (0);
249}
250
251/* qmgr_message_oldstyle_scan - support for Postfix < 1.0 queue files */
252
253static void qmgr_message_oldstyle_scan(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
254{
255 VSTRING *buf;
256 long orig_offset, extra_offset;
257 int rec_type;
258 char *start;
259
260 /*
261 * Initialize. No early returns or we have a memory leak.
262 */
263 buf = vstring_alloc(100);
264 if ((orig_offset = vstream_ftell(message->fp)) < 0)
265 msg_fatal("vstream_ftell %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
266
267 /*
268 * Rewind to the very beginning to make sure we see all records.
269 */
270 if (vstream_fseek(message->fp, 0, SEEK_SET) < 0)
271 msg_fatal("seek file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
272
273 /*
274 * Scan through the old style queue file. Count the total number of
275 * recipients and find the data/extra sections offsets. Note that the new
276 * queue files require that data_size equals extra_offset - data_offset,
277 * so we set data_size to this as well and ignore the size record itself
278 * completely.
279 */
280 message->rcpt_unread = 0;
281 for (;;) {
282 rec_type = rec_get(message->fp, buf, 0);
283 if (rec_type <= 0)
284 /* Report missing end record later. */
285 break;
286 start = vstring_str(buf);
287 if (msg_verbose > 1)
288 msg_info("old-style scan record %c %s", rec_type, start);
289 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_END)
290 break;
291 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_DONE
292 || rec_type == REC_TYPE_RCPT
293 || rec_type == REC_TYPE_DRCP) {
294 message->rcpt_unread++;
295 continue;
296 }
297 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_MESG) {
298 if (message->data_offset == 0) {
299 if ((message->data_offset = vstream_ftell(message->fp)) < 0)
300 msg_fatal("vstream_ftell %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
301 if ((extra_offset = atol(start)) <= message->data_offset)
302 msg_fatal("bad extra offset %s file %s",
303 start, VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
304 if (vstream_fseek(message->fp, extra_offset, SEEK_SET) < 0)
305 msg_fatal("seek file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
306 message->data_size = extra_offset - message->data_offset;
307 }
308 continue;
309 }
310 }
311
312 /*
313 * Clean up.
314 */
315 if (vstream_fseek(message->fp, orig_offset, SEEK_SET) < 0)
316 msg_fatal("seek file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
317 vstring_free(buf);
318
319 /*
320 * Sanity checks. Verify that all required information was found,
321 * including the queue file end marker.
322 */
323 if (message->data_offset == 0 || rec_type != REC_TYPE_END)
324 msg_fatal("%s: envelope records out of order", message->queue_id);
325}
326
327/* qmgr_message_read - read envelope records */
328
329static int qmgr_message_read(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
330{
331 VSTRING *buf;
332 int rec_type;
333 long curr_offset;
334 long save_offset = message->rcpt_offset; /* save a flag */
335 int save_unread = message->rcpt_unread; /* save a count */
336 char *start;
337 int recipient_limit;
338 const char *error_text;
339 char *name;
340 char *value;
341 char *orig_rcpt = 0;
342 int count;
343 int dsn_notify = 0;
344 char *dsn_orcpt = 0;
345 int n;
346 int have_log_client_attr = 0;
347
348 /*
349 * Initialize. No early returns or we have a memory leak.
350 */
351 buf = vstring_alloc(100);
352
353 /*
354 * If we re-open this file, skip over on-file recipient records that we
355 * already looked at, and refill the in-core recipient address list.
356 *
357 * For the first time, the message recipient limit is calculated from the
358 * global recipient limit. This is to avoid reading little recipients
359 * when the active queue is near empty. When the queue becomes full, only
360 * the necessary amount is read in core. Such priming is necessary
361 * because there are no message jobs yet.
362 *
363 * For the next time, the recipient limit is based solely on the message
364 * jobs' positions in the job lists and/or job stacks.
365 */
366 if (message->rcpt_offset) {
367 if (message->rcpt_list.len)
368 msg_panic("%s: recipient list not empty on recipient reload",
369 message->queue_id);
370 if (vstream_fseek(message->fp, message->rcpt_offset, SEEK_SET) < 0)
371 msg_fatal("seek file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
372 message->rcpt_offset = 0;
373 recipient_limit = message->rcpt_limit - message->rcpt_count;
374 } else {
375 recipient_limit = var_qmgr_rcpt_limit - qmgr_recipient_count;
376 if (recipient_limit < message->rcpt_limit)
377 recipient_limit = message->rcpt_limit;
378 }
379 /* Keep interrupt latency in check. */
380 if (recipient_limit > 5000)
381 recipient_limit = 5000;
382 if (recipient_limit <= 0)
383 msg_panic("%s: no recipient slots available", message->queue_id);
384 if (msg_verbose)
385 msg_info("%s: recipient limit %d", message->queue_id, recipient_limit);
386
387 /*
388 * Read envelope records. XXX Rely on the front-end programs to enforce
389 * record size limits. Read up to recipient_limit recipients from the
390 * queue file, to protect against memory exhaustion. Recipient records
391 * may appear before or after the message content, so we keep reading
392 * from the queue file until we have enough recipients (rcpt_offset != 0)
393 * and until we know all the non-recipient information.
394 *
395 * Note that the total recipient count record is accurate only for fresh
396 * queue files. After some of the recipients are marked as done and the
397 * queue file is deferred, it can be used as upper bound estimate only.
398 * Fortunately, this poses no major problem on the scheduling algorithm,
399 * as the only impact is that the already deferred messages are not
400 * chosen by qmgr_job_candidate() as often as they could.
401 *
402 * On the first open, we must examine all non-recipient records.
403 *
404 * Optimization: when we know that recipient records are not mixed with
405 * non-recipient records, as is typical with mailing list mail, then we
406 * can avoid having to examine all the queue file records before we can
407 * start deliveries. This avoids some file system thrashing with huge
408 * mailing lists.
409 */
410 for (;;) {
411 if ((curr_offset = vstream_ftell(message->fp)) < 0)
412 msg_fatal("vstream_ftell %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
413 if (curr_offset == message->data_offset && curr_offset > 0) {
414 if (vstream_fseek(message->fp, message->data_size, SEEK_CUR) < 0)
415 msg_fatal("seek file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
416 curr_offset += message->data_size;
417 }
418 rec_type = rec_get_raw(message->fp, buf, 0, REC_FLAG_NONE);
419 start = vstring_str(buf);
420 if (msg_verbose > 1)
421 msg_info("record %c %s", rec_type, start);
422 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_PTR) {
423 if ((rec_type = rec_goto(message->fp, start)) == REC_TYPE_ERROR)
424 break;
425 /* Need to update curr_offset after pointer jump. */
426 continue;
427 }
428 if (rec_type <= 0) {
429 msg_warn("%s: message rejected: missing end record",
430 message->queue_id);
431 break;
432 }
433 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_END) {
434 message->rflags |= QMGR_READ_FLAG_SEEN_ALL_NON_RCPT;
435 break;
436 }
437
438 /*
439 * Map named attributes to pseudo record types, so that we don't have
440 * to pollute the queue file with records that are incompatible with
441 * past Postfix versions. Preferably, people should be able to back
442 * out from an upgrade without losing mail.
443 */
444 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_ATTR) {
445 if ((error_text = split_nameval(start, &name, &value)) != 0) {
446 msg_warn("%s: ignoring bad attribute: %s: %.200s",
447 message->queue_id, error_text, start);
448 rec_type = REC_TYPE_ERROR;
449 break;
450 }
451 if ((n = rec_attr_map(name)) != 0) {
452 start = value;
453 rec_type = n;
454 }
455 }
456
457 /*
458 * Process recipient records.
459 */
460 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_RCPT) {
461 /* See also below for code setting orig_rcpt etc. */
462 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0) {
463 message->rcpt_unread--;
464 recipient_list_add(&message->rcpt_list, curr_offset,
465 dsn_orcpt ? dsn_orcpt : "",
466 dsn_notify ? dsn_notify : 0,
467 orig_rcpt ? orig_rcpt : "", start);
468 if (dsn_orcpt) {
469 myfree(dsn_orcpt);
470 dsn_orcpt = 0;
471 }
472 if (orig_rcpt) {
473 myfree(orig_rcpt);
474 orig_rcpt = 0;
475 }
476 if (dsn_notify)
477 dsn_notify = 0;
478 if (message->rcpt_list.len >= recipient_limit) {
479 if ((message->rcpt_offset = vstream_ftell(message->fp)) < 0)
480 msg_fatal("vstream_ftell %s: %m",
481 VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
482 if (message->rflags & QMGR_READ_FLAG_SEEN_ALL_NON_RCPT)
483 /* We already examined all non-recipient records. */
484 break;
485 if (message->rflags & QMGR_READ_FLAG_MIXED_RCPT_OTHER)
486 /* Examine all remaining non-recipient records. */
487 continue;
488 /* Optimizations for "pure recipient" record sections. */
489 if (curr_offset > message->data_offset) {
490 /* We already examined all non-recipient records. */
491 message->rflags |= QMGR_READ_FLAG_SEEN_ALL_NON_RCPT;
492 break;
493 }
494 /* Examine non-recipient records in extracted segment. */
495 if (vstream_fseek(message->fp, message->data_offset
496 + message->data_size, SEEK_SET) < 0)
497 msg_fatal("seek file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
498 continue;
499 }
500 }
501 continue;
502 }
503 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_DONE || rec_type == REC_TYPE_DRCP) {
504 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0) {
505 message->rcpt_unread--;
506 if (dsn_orcpt) {
507 myfree(dsn_orcpt);
508 dsn_orcpt = 0;
509 }
510 if (orig_rcpt) {
511 myfree(orig_rcpt);
512 orig_rcpt = 0;
513 }
514 if (dsn_notify)
515 dsn_notify = 0;
516 }
517 continue;
518 }
519 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_DSN_ORCPT) {
520 /* See also above for code clearing dsn_orcpt. */
521 if (dsn_orcpt != 0) {
522 msg_warn("%s: ignoring out-of-order DSN original recipient address <%.200s>",
523 message->queue_id, dsn_orcpt);
524 myfree(dsn_orcpt);
525 dsn_orcpt = 0;
526 }
527 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0)
528 dsn_orcpt = mystrdup(start);
529 continue;
530 }
531 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_DSN_NOTIFY) {
532 /* See also above for code clearing dsn_notify. */
533 if (dsn_notify != 0) {
534 msg_warn("%s: ignoring out-of-order DSN notify flags <%d>",
535 message->queue_id, dsn_notify);
536 dsn_notify = 0;
537 }
538 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0) {
539 if (!alldig(start) || (n = atoi(start)) == 0 || !DSN_NOTIFY_OK(n))
540 msg_warn("%s: ignoring malformed DSN notify flags <%.200s>",
541 message->queue_id, start);
542 else
543 dsn_notify = n;
544 continue;
545 }
546 }
547 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_ORCP) {
548 /* See also above for code clearing orig_rcpt. */
549 if (orig_rcpt != 0) {
550 msg_warn("%s: ignoring out-of-order original recipient <%.200s>",
551 message->queue_id, orig_rcpt);
552 myfree(orig_rcpt);
553 orig_rcpt = 0;
554 }
555 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0)
556 orig_rcpt = mystrdup(start);
557 continue;
558 }
559
560 /*
561 * Process non-recipient records.
562 */
563 if (message->rflags & QMGR_READ_FLAG_SEEN_ALL_NON_RCPT)
564 /* We already examined all non-recipient records. */
565 continue;
566 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_SIZE) {
567 if (message->data_offset == 0) {
568 if ((count = sscanf(start, "%ld %ld %d %d %ld %d",
569 &message->data_size, &message->data_offset,
570 &message->rcpt_unread, &message->rflags,
571 &message->cont_length,
572 &message->smtputf8)) >= 3) {
573 /* Postfix >= 1.0 (a.k.a. 20010228). */
574 if (message->data_offset <= 0 || message->data_size <= 0) {
575 msg_warn("%s: invalid size record: %.100s",
576 message->queue_id, start);
577 rec_type = REC_TYPE_ERROR;
578 break;
579 }
580 if (message->rflags & ~QMGR_READ_FLAG_USER) {
581 msg_warn("%s: invalid flags in size record: %.100s",
582 message->queue_id, start);
583 rec_type = REC_TYPE_ERROR;
584 break;
585 }
586 } else if (count == 1) {
587 /* Postfix < 1.0 (a.k.a. 20010228). */
588 qmgr_message_oldstyle_scan(message);
589 } else {
590 /* Can't happen. */
591 msg_warn("%s: message rejected: weird size record",
592 message->queue_id);
593 rec_type = REC_TYPE_ERROR;
594 break;
595 }
596 }
597 /* Postfix < 2.4 compatibility. */
598 if (message->cont_length == 0) {
599 message->cont_length = message->data_size;
600 } else if (message->cont_length < 0) {
601 msg_warn("%s: invalid size record: %.100s",
602 message->queue_id, start);
603 rec_type = REC_TYPE_ERROR;
604 break;
605 }
606 continue;
607 }
608 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_TIME) {
609 if (message->arrival_time.tv_sec == 0)
610 REC_TYPE_TIME_SCAN(start, message->arrival_time);
611 continue;
612 }
613 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_CTIME) {
614 if (message->create_time == 0)
615 message->create_time = atol(start);
616 continue;
617 }
618 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_FILT) {
619 if (message->filter_xport != 0)
620 myfree(message->filter_xport);
621 message->filter_xport = mystrdup(start);
622 continue;
623 }
624 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_INSP) {
625 if (message->inspect_xport != 0)
626 myfree(message->inspect_xport);
627 message->inspect_xport = mystrdup(start);
628 continue;
629 }
630 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_RDR) {
631 if (message->redirect_addr != 0)
632 myfree(message->redirect_addr);
633 message->redirect_addr = mystrdup(start);
634 continue;
635 }
636 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_FROM) {
637 if (message->sender == 0) {
638 message->sender = mystrdup(start);
639 opened(message->queue_id, message->sender,
640 message->cont_length, message->rcpt_unread,
641 "queue %s", message->queue_name);
642 }
643 continue;
644 }
645 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_DSN_ENVID) {
646 if (message->dsn_envid == 0)
647 message->dsn_envid = mystrdup(start);
648 }
649 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_DSN_RET) {
650 if (message->dsn_ret == 0) {
651 if (!alldig(start) || (n = atoi(start)) == 0 || !DSN_RET_OK(n))
652 msg_warn("%s: ignoring malformed DSN RET flags in queue file record:%.100s",
653 message->queue_id, start);
654 else
655 message->dsn_ret = n;
656 }
657 }
658 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_ATTR) {
659 /* Allow extra segment to override envelope segment info. */
660 if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_ENCODING) == 0) {
661 if (message->encoding != 0)
662 myfree(message->encoding);
663 message->encoding = mystrdup(value);
664 }
665
666 /*
667 * Backwards compatibility. Before Postfix 2.3, the logging
668 * attributes were called client_name, etc. Now they are called
669 * log_client_name. etc., and client_name is used for the actual
670 * client information. To support old queue files we accept both
671 * names for the purpose of logging; the new name overrides the
672 * old one.
673 *
674 * XXX Do not use the "legacy" client_name etc. attribute values for
675 * initializing the logging attributes, when this file already
676 * contains the "modern" log_client_name etc. logging attributes.
677 * Otherwise, logging attributes that are not present in the
678 * queue file would be set with information from the real client.
679 */
680 else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_ACT_CLIENT_NAME) == 0) {
681 if (have_log_client_attr == 0 && message->client_name == 0)
682 message->client_name = mystrdup(value);
683 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_ACT_CLIENT_ADDR) == 0) {
684 if (have_log_client_attr == 0 && message->client_addr == 0)
685 message->client_addr = mystrdup(value);
686 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_ACT_CLIENT_PORT) == 0) {
687 if (have_log_client_attr == 0 && message->client_port == 0)
688 message->client_port = mystrdup(value);
689 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_ACT_PROTO_NAME) == 0) {
690 if (have_log_client_attr == 0 && message->client_proto == 0)
691 message->client_proto = mystrdup(value);
692 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_ACT_HELO_NAME) == 0) {
693 if (have_log_client_attr == 0 && message->client_helo == 0)
694 message->client_helo = mystrdup(value);
695 }
696 /* Original client attributes. */
697 else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_NAME) == 0) {
698 if (message->client_name != 0)
699 myfree(message->client_name);
700 message->client_name = mystrdup(value);
701 have_log_client_attr = 1;
702 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_ADDR) == 0) {
703 if (message->client_addr != 0)
704 myfree(message->client_addr);
705 message->client_addr = mystrdup(value);
706 have_log_client_attr = 1;
707 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_PORT) == 0) {
708 if (message->client_port != 0)
709 myfree(message->client_port);
710 message->client_port = mystrdup(value);
711 have_log_client_attr = 1;
712 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_PROTO_NAME) == 0) {
713 if (message->client_proto != 0)
714 myfree(message->client_proto);
715 message->client_proto = mystrdup(value);
716 have_log_client_attr = 1;
717 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_HELO_NAME) == 0) {
718 if (message->client_helo != 0)
719 myfree(message->client_helo);
720 message->client_helo = mystrdup(value);
721 have_log_client_attr = 1;
722 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_SASL_METHOD) == 0) {
723 if (message->sasl_method == 0)
724 message->sasl_method = mystrdup(value);
725 else
726 msg_warn("%s: ignoring multiple %s attribute: %s",
727 message->queue_id, MAIL_ATTR_SASL_METHOD, value);
728 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_SASL_USERNAME) == 0) {
729 if (message->sasl_username == 0)
730 message->sasl_username = mystrdup(value);
731 else
732 msg_warn("%s: ignoring multiple %s attribute: %s",
733 message->queue_id, MAIL_ATTR_SASL_USERNAME, value);
734 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_SASL_SENDER) == 0) {
735 if (message->sasl_sender == 0)
736 message->sasl_sender = mystrdup(value);
737 else
738 msg_warn("%s: ignoring multiple %s attribute: %s",
739 message->queue_id, MAIL_ATTR_SASL_SENDER, value);
740 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_IDENT) == 0) {
741 if (message->log_ident == 0)
742 message->log_ident = mystrdup(value);
743 else
744 msg_warn("%s: ignoring multiple %s attribute: %s",
745 message->queue_id, MAIL_ATTR_LOG_IDENT, value);
746 } else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_RWR_CONTEXT) == 0) {
747 if (message->rewrite_context == 0)
748 message->rewrite_context = mystrdup(value);
749 else
750 msg_warn("%s: ignoring multiple %s attribute: %s",
751 message->queue_id, MAIL_ATTR_RWR_CONTEXT, value);
752 }
753
754 /*
755 * Optional tracing flags (verify, sendmail -v, sendmail -bv).
756 * This record is killed after a trace logfile report is sent and
757 * after the logfile is deleted.
758 */
759 else if (strcmp(name, MAIL_ATTR_TRACE_FLAGS) == 0) {
760 if (message->tflags == 0) {
761 message->tflags = DEL_REQ_TRACE_FLAGS(atoi(value));
762 if (message->tflags == DEL_REQ_FLAG_RECORD)
763 message->tflags_offset = curr_offset;
764 else
765 message->tflags_offset = 0;
766 if ((message->tflags & DEL_REQ_FLAG_MTA_VRFY) != 0)
767 qmgr_vrfy_pend_count++;
768 }
769 }
770 continue;
771 }
772 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_WARN) {
773 if (message->warn_offset == 0) {
774 message->warn_offset = curr_offset;
775 REC_TYPE_WARN_SCAN(start, message->warn_time);
776 }
777 continue;
778 }
779 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_VERP) {
780 if (message->verp_delims == 0) {
781 if (message->sender == 0 || message->sender[0] == 0) {
782 msg_warn("%s: ignoring VERP request for null sender",
783 message->queue_id);
784 } else if (verp_delims_verify(start) != 0) {
785 msg_warn("%s: ignoring bad VERP request: \"%.100s\"",
786 message->queue_id, start);
787 } else {
788 if (msg_verbose)
789 msg_info("%s: enabling VERP for sender \"%.100s\"",
790 message->queue_id, message->sender);
791 message->single_rcpt = 1;
792 message->verp_delims = mystrdup(start);
793 }
794 }
795 continue;
796 }
797 }
798
799 /*
800 * Grr.
801 */
802 if (dsn_orcpt != 0) {
803 if (rec_type > 0)
804 msg_warn("%s: ignoring out-of-order DSN original recipient <%.200s>",
805 message->queue_id, dsn_orcpt);
806 myfree(dsn_orcpt);
807 }
808 if (orig_rcpt != 0) {
809 if (rec_type > 0)
810 msg_warn("%s: ignoring out-of-order original recipient <%.200s>",
811 message->queue_id, orig_rcpt);
812 myfree(orig_rcpt);
813 }
814
815 /*
816 * After sending a "delayed" warning, request sender notification when
817 * message delivery is completed. While "mail delayed" notifications are
818 * bad enough because they multiply the amount of email traffic, "delay
819 * cleared" notifications are even worse because they come in a sudden
820 * burst when the queue drains after a network outage.
821 */
822 if (var_dsn_delay_cleared && message->warn_time < 0)
823 message->tflags |= DEL_REQ_FLAG_REC_DLY_SENT;
824
825 /*
826 * Remember when we have read the last recipient batch. Note that we do
827 * it here after reading as reading might have used considerable amount
828 * of time.
829 */
830 message->refill_time = sane_time();
831
832 /*
833 * Avoid clumsiness elsewhere in the program. When sending data across an
834 * IPC channel, sending an empty string is more convenient than sending a
835 * null pointer.
836 */
837 if (message->dsn_envid == 0)
838 message->dsn_envid = mystrdup("");
839 if (message->encoding == 0)
840 message->encoding = mystrdup(MAIL_ATTR_ENC_NONE);
841 if (message->client_name == 0)
842 message->client_name = mystrdup("");
843 if (message->client_addr == 0)
844 message->client_addr = mystrdup("");
845 if (message->client_port == 0)
846 message->client_port = mystrdup("");
847 if (message->client_proto == 0)
848 message->client_proto = mystrdup("");
849 if (message->client_helo == 0)
850 message->client_helo = mystrdup("");
851 if (message->sasl_method == 0)
852 message->sasl_method = mystrdup("");
853 if (message->sasl_username == 0)
854 message->sasl_username = mystrdup("");
855 if (message->sasl_sender == 0)
856 message->sasl_sender = mystrdup("");
857 if (message->log_ident == 0)
858 message->log_ident = mystrdup("");
859 if (message->rewrite_context == 0)
860 message->rewrite_context = mystrdup(MAIL_ATTR_RWR_LOCAL);
861 /* Postfix < 2.3 compatibility. */
862 if (message->create_time == 0)
863 message->create_time = message->arrival_time.tv_sec;
864
865 /*
866 * Clean up.
867 */
868 vstring_free(buf);
869
870 /*
871 * Sanity checks. Verify that all required information was found,
872 * including the queue file end marker.
873 */
874 if (message->rcpt_unread < 0
875 || (message->rcpt_offset == 0 && message->rcpt_unread != 0)) {
876 msg_warn("%s: rcpt count mismatch (%d)",
877 message->queue_id, message->rcpt_unread);
878 message->rcpt_unread = 0;
879 }
880 if (rec_type <= 0) {
881 /* Already logged warning. */
882 } else if (message->arrival_time.tv_sec == 0) {
883 msg_warn("%s: message rejected: missing arrival time record",
884 message->queue_id);
885 } else if (message->sender == 0) {
886 msg_warn("%s: message rejected: missing sender record",
887 message->queue_id);
888 } else if (message->data_offset == 0) {
889 msg_warn("%s: message rejected: missing size record",
890 message->queue_id);
891 } else {
892 return (0);
893 }
894 message->rcpt_offset = save_offset; /* restore flag */
895 message->rcpt_unread = save_unread; /* restore count */
896 recipient_list_free(&message->rcpt_list);
897 recipient_list_init(&message->rcpt_list, RCPT_LIST_INIT_QUEUE);
898 return (-1);
899}
900
901/* qmgr_message_update_warn - update the time of next delay warning */
902
903void qmgr_message_update_warn(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
904{
905
906 /*
907 * After the "mail delayed" warning, optionally send a "delay cleared"
908 * notification.
909 */
910 if (qmgr_message_open(message)
911 || vstream_fseek(message->fp, message->warn_offset, SEEK_SET) < 0
912 || rec_fprintf(message->fp, REC_TYPE_WARN, REC_TYPE_WARN_FORMAT,
913 REC_TYPE_WARN_ARG(-1)) < 0
914 || vstream_fflush(message->fp))
915 msg_fatal("update queue file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
916 qmgr_message_close(message);
917}
918
919/* qmgr_message_kill_record - mark one message record as killed */
920
921void qmgr_message_kill_record(QMGR_MESSAGE *message, long offset)
922{
923 if (offset <= 0)
924 msg_panic("qmgr_message_kill_record: bad offset 0x%lx", offset);
925 if (qmgr_message_open(message)
926 || rec_put_type(message->fp, REC_TYPE_KILL, offset) < 0
927 || vstream_fflush(message->fp))
928 msg_fatal("update queue file %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
929 qmgr_message_close(message);
930}
931
932/* qmgr_message_sort_compare - compare recipient information */
933
934static int qmgr_message_sort_compare(const void *p1, const void *p2)
935{
936 RECIPIENT *rcpt1 = (RECIPIENT *) p1;
937 RECIPIENT *rcpt2 = (RECIPIENT *) p2;
938 QMGR_QUEUE *queue1;
939 QMGR_QUEUE *queue2;
940 char *at1;
941 char *at2;
942 int result;
943
944 /*
945 * Compare most significant to least significant recipient attributes.
946 * The comparison function must be transitive, so NULL values need to be
947 * assigned an ordinal (we set NULL last).
948 */
949
950 queue1 = rcpt1->u.queue;
951 queue2 = rcpt2->u.queue;
952 if (queue1 != 0 && queue2 == 0)
953 return (-1);
954 if (queue1 == 0 && queue2 != 0)
955 return (1);
956 if (queue1 != 0 && queue2 != 0) {
957
958 /*
959 * Compare message transport.
960 */
961 if ((result = strcmp(queue1->transport->name,
962 queue2->transport->name)) != 0)
963 return (result);
964
965 /*
966 * Compare queue name (nexthop or recipient@nexthop).
967 */
968 if ((result = strcmp(queue1->name, queue2->name)) != 0)
969 return (result);
970 }
971
972 /*
973 * Compare recipient domain.
974 */
975 at1 = strrchr(rcpt1->address, '@');
976 at2 = strrchr(rcpt2->address, '@');
977 if (at1 == 0 && at2 != 0)
978 return (1);
979 if (at1 != 0 && at2 == 0)
980 return (-1);
981 if (at1 != 0 && at2 != 0
982 && (result = strcasecmp_utf8(at1, at2)) != 0)
983 return (result);
984
985 /*
986 * Compare recipient address.
987 */
988 return (strcmp(rcpt1->address, rcpt2->address));
989}
990
991/* qmgr_message_sort - sort message recipient addresses by domain */
992
993static void qmgr_message_sort(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
994{
995 qsort((void *) message->rcpt_list.info, message->rcpt_list.len,
996 sizeof(message->rcpt_list.info[0]), qmgr_message_sort_compare);
997 if (msg_verbose) {
998 RECIPIENT_LIST list = message->rcpt_list;
999 RECIPIENT *rcpt;
1000
1001 msg_info("start sorted recipient list");
1002 for (rcpt = list.info; rcpt < list.info + list.len; rcpt++)
1003 msg_info("qmgr_message_sort: %s", rcpt->address);
1004 msg_info("end sorted recipient list");
1005 }
1006}
1007
1008/* qmgr_resolve_one - resolve or skip one recipient */
1009
1010static int qmgr_resolve_one(QMGR_MESSAGE *message, RECIPIENT *recipient,
1011 const char *addr, RESOLVE_REPLY *reply)
1012{
1013#define QMGR_REDIRECT(rp, tp, np) do { \
1014 (rp)->flags = 0; \
1015 vstring_strcpy((rp)->transport, (tp)); \
1016 vstring_strcpy((rp)->nexthop, (np)); \
1017 } while (0)
1018
1019 if ((message->tflags & DEL_REQ_FLAG_MTA_VRFY) == 0)
1020 resolve_clnt_query_from(message->sender, addr, reply);
1021 else
1022 resolve_clnt_verify_from(message->sender, addr, reply);
1023 if (reply->flags & RESOLVE_FLAG_FAIL) {
1024 QMGR_REDIRECT(reply, MAIL_SERVICE_RETRY,
1025 "4.3.0 address resolver failure");
1026 return (0);
1027 } else if (reply->flags & RESOLVE_FLAG_ERROR) {
1028 QMGR_REDIRECT(reply, MAIL_SERVICE_ERROR,
1029 "5.1.3 bad address syntax");
1030 return (0);
1031 } else {
1032 return (0);
1033 }
1034}
1035
1036/* qmgr_message_resolve - resolve recipients */
1037
1038static void qmgr_message_resolve(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
1039{
1040 static ARGV *defer_xport_argv;
1041 RECIPIENT_LIST list = message->rcpt_list;
1042 RECIPIENT *recipient;
1043 QMGR_TRANSPORT *transport = 0;
1044 QMGR_QUEUE *queue = 0;
1045 RESOLVE_REPLY reply;
1046 VSTRING *queue_name;
1047 char *at;
1048 char **cpp;
1049 char *nexthop;
1050 ssize_t len;
1051 int status;
1052 DSN dsn;
1053 MSG_STATS stats;
1054 DSN *saved_dsn;
1055
1056#define STREQ(x,y) (strcmp(x,y) == 0)
1057#define STR vstring_str
1058#define LEN VSTRING_LEN
1059
1060 resolve_clnt_init(&reply);
1061 queue_name = vstring_alloc(1);
1062 for (recipient = list.info; recipient < list.info + list.len; recipient++) {
1063
1064 /*
1065 * Redirect overrides all else. But only once (per entire message).
1066 * For consistency with the remainder of Postfix, rewrite the address
1067 * to canonical form before resolving it.
1068 */
1069 if (message->redirect_addr) {
1070 if (recipient > list.info) {
1071 recipient->u.queue = 0;
1072 continue;
1073 }
1074 message->rcpt_offset = 0;
1075 message->rcpt_unread = 0;
1076
1077 rewrite_clnt_internal(REWRITE_CANON, message->redirect_addr,
1078 reply.recipient);
1079 RECIPIENT_UPDATE(recipient->address, STR(reply.recipient));
1080 if (qmgr_resolve_one(message, recipient,
1081 recipient->address, &reply) < 0)
1082 continue;
1083 if (!STREQ(recipient->address, STR(reply.recipient)))
1084 RECIPIENT_UPDATE(recipient->address, STR(reply.recipient));
1085 }
1086
1087 /*
1088 * Content filtering overrides the address resolver.
1089 *
1090 * XXX Bypass content_filter inspection for user-generated probes
1091 * (sendmail -bv). MTA-generated probes never have the "please filter
1092 * me" bits turned on, but we handle them here anyway for the sake of
1093 * future proofing.
1094 */
1095#define FILTER_WITHOUT_NEXTHOP(filter, next) \
1096 (((next) = split_at((filter), ':')) == 0 || *(next) == 0)
1097
1098#define RCPT_WITHOUT_DOMAIN(rcpt, next) \
1099 ((next = strrchr(rcpt, '@')) == 0 || *++(next) == 0)
1100
1101 else if (message->filter_xport
1102 && (message->tflags & DEL_REQ_TRACE_ONLY_MASK) == 0) {
1103 reply.flags = 0;
1104 vstring_strcpy(reply.transport, message->filter_xport);
1105 if (FILTER_WITHOUT_NEXTHOP(STR(reply.transport), nexthop)
1106 && *(nexthop = var_def_filter_nexthop) == 0
1107 && RCPT_WITHOUT_DOMAIN(recipient->address, nexthop))
1108 nexthop = var_myhostname;
1109 vstring_strcpy(reply.nexthop, nexthop);
1110 vstring_strcpy(reply.recipient, recipient->address);
1111 }
1112
1113 /*
1114 * Resolve the destination to (transport, nexthop, address). The
1115 * result address may differ from the one specified by the sender.
1116 */
1117 else {
1118 if (qmgr_resolve_one(message, recipient,
1119 recipient->address, &reply) < 0)
1120 continue;
1121 if (!STREQ(recipient->address, STR(reply.recipient)))
1122 RECIPIENT_UPDATE(recipient->address, STR(reply.recipient));
1123 }
1124
1125 /*
1126 * Bounce null recipients. This should never happen, but is most
1127 * likely the result of a fault in a different program, so aborting
1128 * the queue manager process does not help.
1129 */
1130 if (recipient->address[0] == 0) {
1131 QMGR_REDIRECT(&reply, MAIL_SERVICE_ERROR,
1132 "5.1.3 null recipient address");
1133 }
1134
1135 /*
1136 * Discard mail to the local double bounce address here, so this
1137 * system can run without a local delivery agent. They'd still have
1138 * to configure something for mail directed to the local postmaster,
1139 * though, but that is an RFC requirement anyway.
1140 *
1141 * XXX This lookup should be done in the resolver, and the mail should
1142 * be directed to a general-purpose null delivery agent.
1143 */
1144 if (reply.flags & RESOLVE_CLASS_LOCAL) {
1145 at = strrchr(STR(reply.recipient), '@');
1146 len = (at ? (at - STR(reply.recipient))
1147 : strlen(STR(reply.recipient)));
1148 if (strncasecmp_utf8(STR(reply.recipient),
1149 var_double_bounce_sender, len) == 0
1150 && !var_double_bounce_sender[len]) {
1151 status = sent(message->tflags, message->queue_id,
1152 QMGR_MSG_STATS(&stats, message), recipient,
1153 "none", DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "2.0.0",
1154 "undeliverable postmaster notification discarded"));
1155 if (status == 0) {
1156 deliver_completed(message->fp, recipient->offset);
1157#if 0
1158 /* It's the default verification probe sender address. */
1159 msg_warn("%s: undeliverable postmaster notification discarded",
1160 message->queue_id);
1161#endif
1162 } else
1163 message->flags |= status;
1164 continue;
1165 }
1166 }
1167
1168 /*
1169 * Optionally defer deliveries over specific transports, unless the
1170 * restriction is lifted temporarily.
1171 */
1172 if (*var_defer_xports && (message->qflags & QMGR_FLUSH_DFXP) == 0) {
1173 if (defer_xport_argv == 0)
1174 defer_xport_argv = argv_split(var_defer_xports, CHARS_COMMA_SP);
1175 for (cpp = defer_xport_argv->argv; *cpp; cpp++)
1176 if (strcmp(*cpp, STR(reply.transport)) == 0)
1177 break;
1178 if (*cpp) {
1179 QMGR_REDIRECT(&reply, MAIL_SERVICE_RETRY,
1180 "4.3.2 deferred transport");
1181 }
1182 }
1183
1184 /*
1185 * Safety: defer excess address verification requests.
1186 */
1187 if ((message->tflags & DEL_REQ_FLAG_MTA_VRFY) != 0
1188 && qmgr_vrfy_pend_count > var_vrfy_pend_limit)
1189 QMGR_REDIRECT(&reply, MAIL_SERVICE_RETRY,
1190 "4.3.2 Too many address verification requests");
1191
1192 /*
1193 * Look up or instantiate the proper transport.
1194 */
1195 if (transport == 0 || !STREQ(transport->name, STR(reply.transport))) {
1196 if ((transport = qmgr_transport_find(STR(reply.transport))) == 0)
1197 transport = qmgr_transport_create(STR(reply.transport));
1198 queue = 0;
1199 }
1200
1201 /*
1202 * This message is being flushed. If need-be unthrottle the
1203 * transport.
1204 */
1205 if ((message->qflags & QMGR_FLUSH_EACH) != 0
1206 && QMGR_TRANSPORT_THROTTLED(transport))
1207 qmgr_transport_unthrottle(transport);
1208
1209 /*
1210 * This transport is dead. Defer delivery to this recipient.
1211 */
1212 if (QMGR_TRANSPORT_THROTTLED(transport)) {
1213 saved_dsn = transport->dsn;
1214 if ((transport = qmgr_error_transport(MAIL_SERVICE_RETRY)) != 0) {
1215 nexthop = qmgr_error_nexthop(saved_dsn);
1216 vstring_strcpy(reply.nexthop, nexthop);
1217 myfree(nexthop);
1218 queue = 0;
1219 } else {
1220 qmgr_defer_recipient(message, recipient, saved_dsn);
1221 continue;
1222 }
1223 }
1224
1225 /*
1226 * The nexthop destination provides the default name for the
1227 * per-destination queue. When the delivery agent accepts only one
1228 * recipient per delivery, give each recipient its own queue, so that
1229 * deliveries to different recipients of the same message can happen
1230 * in parallel, and so that we can enforce per-recipient concurrency
1231 * limits and prevent one recipient from tying up all the delivery
1232 * agent resources. We use recipient@nexthop as queue name rather
1233 * than the actual recipient domain name, so that one recipient in
1234 * multiple equivalent domains cannot evade the per-recipient
1235 * concurrency limit. Split the address on the recipient delimiter if
1236 * one is defined, so that extended addresses don't get extra
1237 * delivery slots.
1238 *
1239 * Fold the result to lower case so that we don't have multiple queues
1240 * for the same name.
1241 *
1242 * Important! All recipients in a queue must have the same nexthop
1243 * value. It is OK to have multiple queues with the same nexthop
1244 * value, but only when those queues are named after recipients.
1245 *
1246 * The single-recipient code below was written for local(8) like
1247 * delivery agents, and assumes that all domains that deliver to the
1248 * same (transport + nexthop) are aliases for $nexthop. Delivery
1249 * concurrency is changed from per-domain into per-recipient, by
1250 * changing the queue name from nexthop into localpart@nexthop.
1251 *
1252 * XXX This assumption is incorrect when different destinations share
1253 * the same (transport + nexthop). In reality, such transports are
1254 * rarely configured to use single-recipient deliveries. The fix is
1255 * to decouple the per-destination recipient limit from the
1256 * per-destination concurrency.
1257 */
1258 vstring_strcpy(queue_name, STR(reply.nexthop));
1259 if (strcmp(transport->name, MAIL_SERVICE_ERROR) != 0
1260 && strcmp(transport->name, MAIL_SERVICE_RETRY) != 0
1261 && transport->recipient_limit == 1) {
1262 /* Copy the recipient localpart. */
1263 at = strrchr(STR(reply.recipient), '@');
1264 len = (at ? (at - STR(reply.recipient))
1265 : strlen(STR(reply.recipient)));
1266 vstring_strncpy(queue_name, STR(reply.recipient), len);
1267 /* Remove the address extension from the recipient localpart. */
1268 if (*var_rcpt_delim && split_addr(STR(queue_name), var_rcpt_delim))
1269 vstring_truncate(queue_name, strlen(STR(queue_name)));
1270 /* Assume the recipient domain is equivalent to nexthop. */
1271 vstring_sprintf_append(queue_name, "@%s", STR(reply.nexthop));
1272 }
1273 lowercase(STR(queue_name));
1274
1275 /*
1276 * This transport is alive. Find or instantiate a queue for this
1277 * recipient.
1278 */
1279 if (queue == 0 || !STREQ(queue->name, STR(queue_name))) {
1280 if ((queue = qmgr_queue_find(transport, STR(queue_name))) == 0)
1281 queue = qmgr_queue_create(transport, STR(queue_name),
1282 STR(reply.nexthop));
1283 }
1284
1285 /*
1286 * This message is being flushed. If need-be unthrottle the queue.
1287 */
1288 if ((message->qflags & QMGR_FLUSH_EACH) != 0
1289 && QMGR_QUEUE_THROTTLED(queue))
1290 qmgr_queue_unthrottle(queue);
1291
1292 /*
1293 * This queue is dead. Defer delivery to this recipient.
1294 */
1295 if (QMGR_QUEUE_THROTTLED(queue)) {
1296 saved_dsn = queue->dsn;
1297 if ((queue = qmgr_error_queue(MAIL_SERVICE_RETRY, saved_dsn)) == 0) {
1298 qmgr_defer_recipient(message, recipient, saved_dsn);
1299 continue;
1300 }
1301 }
1302
1303 /*
1304 * This queue is alive. Bind this recipient to this queue instance.
1305 */
1306 recipient->u.queue = queue;
1307 }
1308 resolve_clnt_free(&reply);
1309 vstring_free(queue_name);
1310}
1311
1312/* qmgr_message_assign - assign recipients to specific delivery requests */
1313
1314static void qmgr_message_assign(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
1315{
1316 RECIPIENT_LIST list = message->rcpt_list;
1317 RECIPIENT *recipient;
1318 QMGR_ENTRY *entry = 0;
1319 QMGR_QUEUE *queue;
1320 QMGR_JOB *job = 0;
1321 QMGR_PEER *peer = 0;
1322
1323 /*
1324 * Try to bundle as many recipients in a delivery request as we can. When
1325 * the recipient resolves to the same site and transport as an existing
1326 * recipient, do not create a new queue entry, just move that recipient
1327 * to the recipient list of the existing queue entry. All this provided
1328 * that we do not exceed the transport-specific limit on the number of
1329 * recipients per transaction.
1330 */
1331#define LIMIT_OK(limit, count) ((limit) == 0 || ((count) < (limit)))
1332
1333 for (recipient = list.info; recipient < list.info + list.len; recipient++) {
1334
1335 /*
1336 * Skip recipients with a dead transport or destination.
1337 */
1338 if ((queue = recipient->u.queue) == 0)
1339 continue;
1340
1341 /*
1342 * Lookup or instantiate the message job if necessary.
1343 */
1344 if (job == 0 || queue->transport != job->transport) {
1345 job = qmgr_job_obtain(message, queue->transport);
1346 peer = 0;
1347 }
1348
1349 /*
1350 * Lookup or instantiate job peer if necessary.
1351 */
1352 if (peer == 0 || queue != peer->queue)
1353 peer = qmgr_peer_obtain(job, queue);
1354
1355 /*
1356 * Lookup old or instantiate new recipient entry. We try to reuse the
1357 * last existing entry whenever the recipient limit permits.
1358 */
1359 entry = peer->entry_list.prev;
1360 if (message->single_rcpt || entry == 0
1361 || !LIMIT_OK(queue->transport->recipient_limit, entry->rcpt_list.len))
1362 entry = qmgr_entry_create(peer, message);
1363
1364 /*
1365 * Add the recipient to the current entry and increase all those
1366 * recipient counters accordingly.
1367 */
1368 recipient_list_add(&entry->rcpt_list, recipient->offset,
1369 recipient->dsn_orcpt, recipient->dsn_notify,
1370 recipient->orig_addr, recipient->address);
1371 job->rcpt_count++;
1372 message->rcpt_count++;
1373 qmgr_recipient_count++;
1374 }
1375
1376 /*
1377 * Release the message recipient list and reinitialize it for the next
1378 * time.
1379 */
1380 recipient_list_free(&message->rcpt_list);
1381 recipient_list_init(&message->rcpt_list, RCPT_LIST_INIT_QUEUE);
1382
1383 /*
1384 * Note that even if qmgr_job_obtain() reset the job candidate cache of
1385 * all transports to which we assigned new recipients, this message may
1386 * have other jobs which we didn't touch at all this time. But the number
1387 * of unread recipients affecting the candidate selection might have
1388 * changed considerably, so we must invalidate the caches if it might be
1389 * of some use.
1390 */
1391 for (job = message->job_list.next; job; job = job->message_peers.next)
1392 if (job->selected_entries < job->read_entries
1393 && job->blocker_tag != job->transport->blocker_tag)
1394 job->transport->candidate_cache_current = 0;
1395}
1396
1397/* qmgr_message_move_limits - recycle unused recipient slots */
1398
1399static void qmgr_message_move_limits(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
1400{
1401 QMGR_JOB *job;
1402
1403 for (job = message->job_list.next; job; job = job->message_peers.next)
1404 qmgr_job_move_limits(job);
1405}
1406
1407/* qmgr_message_free - release memory for in-core message structure */
1408
1409void qmgr_message_free(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
1410{
1411 QMGR_JOB *job;
1412
1413 if (message->refcount != 0)
1414 msg_panic("qmgr_message_free: reference len: %d", message->refcount);
1415 if (message->fp)
1416 msg_panic("qmgr_message_free: queue file is open");
1417 while ((job = message->job_list.next) != 0)
1418 qmgr_job_free(job);
1419 myfree(message->queue_id);
1420 myfree(message->queue_name);
1421 if (message->dsn_envid)
1422 myfree(message->dsn_envid);
1423 if (message->encoding)
1424 myfree(message->encoding);
1425 if (message->sender)
1426 myfree(message->sender);
1427 if (message->verp_delims)
1428 myfree(message->verp_delims);
1429 if (message->filter_xport)
1430 myfree(message->filter_xport);
1431 if (message->inspect_xport)
1432 myfree(message->inspect_xport);
1433 if (message->redirect_addr)
1434 myfree(message->redirect_addr);
1435 if (message->client_name)
1436 myfree(message->client_name);
1437 if (message->client_addr)
1438 myfree(message->client_addr);
1439 if (message->client_port)
1440 myfree(message->client_port);
1441 if (message->client_proto)
1442 myfree(message->client_proto);
1443 if (message->client_helo)
1444 myfree(message->client_helo);
1445 if (message->sasl_method)
1446 myfree(message->sasl_method);
1447 if (message->sasl_username)
1448 myfree(message->sasl_username);
1449 if (message->sasl_sender)
1450 myfree(message->sasl_sender);
1451 if (message->log_ident)
1452 myfree(message->log_ident);
1453 if (message->rewrite_context)
1454 myfree(message->rewrite_context);
1455 recipient_list_free(&message->rcpt_list);
1456 qmgr_message_count--;
1457 if ((message->tflags & DEL_REQ_FLAG_MTA_VRFY) != 0)
1458 qmgr_vrfy_pend_count--;
1459 myfree((void *) message);
1460}
1461
1462/* qmgr_message_alloc - create in-core message structure */
1463
1464QMGR_MESSAGE *qmgr_message_alloc(const char *queue_name, const char *queue_id,
1465 int qflags, mode_t mode)
1466{
1467 const char *myname = "qmgr_message_alloc";
1468 QMGR_MESSAGE *message;
1469
1470 if (msg_verbose)
1471 msg_info("%s: %s %s", myname, queue_name, queue_id);
1472
1473 /*
1474 * Create an in-core message structure.
1475 */
1476 message = qmgr_message_create(queue_name, queue_id, qflags);
1477
1478 /*
1479 * Extract message envelope information: time of arrival, sender address,
1480 * recipient addresses. Skip files with malformed envelope information.
1481 */
1482#define QMGR_LOCK_MODE (MYFLOCK_OP_EXCLUSIVE | MYFLOCK_OP_NOWAIT)
1483
1484 if (qmgr_message_open(message) < 0) {
1485 qmgr_message_free(message);
1486 return (0);
1487 }
1488 if (myflock(vstream_fileno(message->fp), INTERNAL_LOCK, QMGR_LOCK_MODE) < 0) {
1489 msg_info("%s: skipped, still being delivered", queue_id);
1490 qmgr_message_close(message);
1491 qmgr_message_free(message);
1492 return (QMGR_MESSAGE_LOCKED);
1493 }
1494 if (qmgr_message_read(message) < 0) {
1495 qmgr_message_close(message);
1496 qmgr_message_free(message);
1497 return (0);
1498 } else {
1499
1500 /*
1501 * We have validated the queue file content, so it is safe to modify
1502 * the file properties now.
1503 */
1504 if (mode != 0 && fchmod(vstream_fileno(message->fp), mode) < 0)
1505 msg_fatal("fchmod %s: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(message->fp));
1506
1507 /*
1508 * Reset the defer log. This code should not be here, but we must
1509 * reset the defer log *after* acquiring the exclusive lock on the
1510 * queue file and *before* resolving new recipients. Since all those
1511 * operations are encapsulated so nicely by this routine, the defer
1512 * log reset has to be done here as well.
1513 *
1514 * Note: it is safe to remove the defer logfile from a previous queue
1515 * run of this queue file, because the defer log contains information
1516 * about recipients that still exist in this queue file.
1517 */
1518 if (mail_queue_remove(MAIL_QUEUE_DEFER, queue_id) && errno != ENOENT)
1519 msg_fatal("%s: %s: remove %s %s: %m", myname,
1520 queue_id, MAIL_QUEUE_DEFER, queue_id);
1521 qmgr_message_sort(message);
1522 qmgr_message_resolve(message);
1523 qmgr_message_sort(message);
1524 qmgr_message_assign(message);
1525 qmgr_message_close(message);
1526 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0)
1527 qmgr_message_move_limits(message);
1528 return (message);
1529 }
1530}
1531
1532/* qmgr_message_realloc - refresh in-core message structure */
1533
1534QMGR_MESSAGE *qmgr_message_realloc(QMGR_MESSAGE *message)
1535{
1536 const char *myname = "qmgr_message_realloc";
1537
1538 /*
1539 * Sanity checks.
1540 */
1541 if (message->rcpt_offset <= 0)
1542 msg_panic("%s: invalid offset: %ld", myname, message->rcpt_offset);
1543 if (msg_verbose)
1544 msg_info("%s: %s %s offset %ld", myname, message->queue_name,
1545 message->queue_id, message->rcpt_offset);
1546
1547 /*
1548 * Extract recipient addresses. Skip files with malformed envelope
1549 * information.
1550 */
1551 if (qmgr_message_open(message) < 0)
1552 return (0);
1553 if (qmgr_message_read(message) < 0) {
1554 qmgr_message_close(message);
1555 return (0);
1556 } else {
1557 qmgr_message_sort(message);
1558 qmgr_message_resolve(message);
1559 qmgr_message_sort(message);
1560 qmgr_message_assign(message);
1561 qmgr_message_close(message);
1562 if (message->rcpt_offset == 0)
1563 qmgr_message_move_limits(message);
1564 return (message);
1565 }
1566}
